list.name: Changes
list.comment: Refactor items and weapons system: remove legacy `items.py` and `weapons.py`, introduce `item_types.py` for centralized item definitions, use `ItemType` and `ItemRarity` enums, and streamline item behavior with new base classes.

task.summary: Initialize project: add game framework, constants, settings, and basic game states.
Refactor and enhance: rename project to "Deadlock," update constants, add camera system, implement background rendering, create player and entity base classes, and add game design documentation.
Add zombie entities: implement Zombie class, spawning logic, movement toward the player, and rendering functionality.

Add map generation system: implement `MapGenerator` with tile-based map creation, introduce debug mode in gameplay state, adjust player and zombie behaviors for tile interactions, and add building templates.

Add weapon, item, and advanced entity systems: implement item pickups, health packs, weapons (Pistol), bullets, zombie variants (ToughZombie), and player combat mechanics; enhance movement, aiming, collisions, and notifications.

Add weapon hierarchy and effect systems: implement multiple weapon types (Pistol, Shotgun, Assault Rifle, Sniper Rifle, Bazooka) with unique attributes, enhance item spawning with tier-based progression, integrate visual effects for muzzle flashes, bullet impacts, and blood splatter, and update player continuous firing mechanics.
Add visual effect classes: implement `Effect` base class and derived classes (`MuzzleFlash`, `BulletImpact`, `BloodSplatter`) for handling and rendering dynamic visual effects.
Add visual effect classes: implement `Effect` base class and derived classes (`MuzzleFlash`, `BulletImpact`, `BloodSplatter`) for handling and rendering dynamic visual effects.

Implement texture atlas system: add `TextureAtlas` for efficient sprite management, refactor `AssetManager` to integrate the atlas, introduce backward compatibility for legacy sprite access, update extraction logic for organized sprite loading from spritesheets, and enhance debugging support with new utilities.

Enhance rendering and gameplay systems: implement sprite-based rendering fallback for items and zombies, integrate texture atlas for efficient sprite management, refine tile generation with dynamic sprite selection, and add directional zombie rendering with rotation and tinting.

Update bullet collision logic and zombie movement mechanics: modify `is_bullet_passable()` check for map collisions, update zombie movement to adjust for objects with speed multiplier, and refine rendering for zombies on objects with transparency.

Update zombie collision logic and IDE settings: adjust zombie collision check to use `zombie_spawner.get_zombies()` and configure IDE for Python 3.11 with additional documentation and formatting settings.

Integrate centralized collision system: replace entity-specific collision checks with unified `collisions` module, enhance zombie and player movement with collision resolution, implement zombie item drops, and update map walkability logic.

Refactor zombie spawning system: replace `ZombieSpawner` with `EnemySpawner`, streamline spawn logic in `constants.py`, integrate item drops for zombie deaths, update explosion damage and effects, and implement multi-weapon inventory for the player.

Refactor items and weapons system: remove legacy `items.py` and `weapons.py`, introduce `item_types.py` for centralized item definitions, use `ItemType` and `ItemRarity` enums, and streamline item behavior with new base classes.

MESSAGE.value: Initialize project structure with core game logic, settings, constants, and main script. Add requirements and initial tests.
Initialize project: add game framework, constants, settings, and basic game states.
Refactor and enhance: rename project to "Deadlock," update constants, add camera system, implement background rendering, create player and entity base classes, and add game design documentation.
Add zombie entities: implement Zombie class, spawning logic, movement toward the player, and rendering functionality.

Add map generation system: implement `MapGenerator` with tile-based map creation, introduce debug mode in gameplay state, adjust player and zombie behaviors for tile interactions, and add building templates.

Add weapon, item, and advanced entity systems: implement item pickups, health packs, weapons (Pistol), bullets, zombie variants (ToughZombie), and player combat mechanics; enhance movement, aiming, collisions, and notifications.

Add weapon hierarchy and effect systems: implement multiple weapon types (Pistol, Shotgun, Assault Rifle, Sniper Rifle, Bazooka) with unique attributes, enhance item spawning with tier-based progression, integrate visual effects for muzzle flashes, bullet impacts, and blood splatter, and update player continuous firing mechanics.
Add visual effect classes: implement `Effect` base class and derived classes (`MuzzleFlash`, `BulletImpact`, `BloodSplatter`) for handling and rendering dynamic visual effects.

Implement texture atlas system: add `TextureAtlas` for efficient sprite management, refactor `AssetManager` to integrate the atlas, introduce backward compatibility for legacy sprite access, update extraction logic for organized sprite loading from spritesheets, and enhance debugging support with new utilities.

Enhance rendering and gameplay systems: implement sprite-based rendering fallback for items and zombies, integrate texture atlas for efficient sprite management, refine tile generation with dynamic sprite selection, and add directional zombie rendering with rotation and tinting.

Update bullet collision logic and zombie movement mechanics: modify `is_bullet_passable()` check for map collisions, update zombie movement to adjust for objects with speed multiplier, and refine rendering for zombies on objects with transparency.

Update zombie collision logic and IDE settings: adjust zombie collision check to use `zombie_spawner.get_zombies()` and configure IDE for Python 3.11 with additional documentation and formatting settings.

Integrate centralized collision system: replace entity-specific collision checks with unified `collisions` module, enhance zombie and player movement with collision resolution, implement zombie item drops, and update map walkability logic.

Refactor zombie spawning system: replace `ZombieSpawner` with `EnemySpawner`, streamline spawn logic in `constants.py`, integrate item drops for zombie deaths, update explosion damage and effects, and implement multi-weapon inventory for the player.

Refactor items and weapons system: remove legacy `items.py` and `weapons.py`, introduce `item_types.py` for centralized item definitions, use `ItemType` and `ItemRarity` enums, and streamline item behavior with new base classes.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Refactor items and weapons system: remove legacy `items.py` and `weapons.py`, introduce `item_types.py` for centralized item definitions, use `ItemType` and `ItemRarity` enums, and streamline item behavior with new base classes.
